definition: to have an in depth conversation/to have intimate talks/to discuss thoroughly
deep/depth/deeply/(of a color) dark/deep/rich
old variant of 深[shen1]
to speak/to talk/to converse/to chat/to discuss
surname Tan

sentences.english: He was in the depth of despair.
sentences.chinese: 这个问题我没同他深谈。

sentences.english: I didn't go in depth into the matter with him.
sentences.chinese: 这个问题我没同他深谈。

sentences.english: Don't talk loudly about too personal things in public.
sentences.chinese: 在人多的场合不宜大声深谈。

sentences.english: That night, my father and I talk, depicting his ambition.
sentences.chinese: 那晚，我和父亲深谈，描绘自己的理想抱负。

sentences.english: There were three professors at the railway station. They were deep in conversation.
sentences.chinese: 有三位教授在火车站，他们正在深谈。

sentences.english: If a woman shuts off, there's trouble brewing and it's time for deep discussion.
sentences.chinese: 如果女人闭了嘴，那是在酝酿麻烦，你该和她深谈了。

definition: a long talk
to give one's bare heart into sb else's keeping (idiom); sb has one's absolute confidence/to trust completely/to confide in sb with entire sincerity
commune/private discussion
to chat
to meet with/meeting
variant of 開誠布公|开诚布公[kai1 cheng2 bu4 gong1]
lit. deal sincerely and fairly (idiom); frank and open-minded/plain speaking/Let's talk frankly and openly between ourselves./to put one's cards on the table
to meet (in person)/to meet with sb
to talk (with sb)/to have a conversation/talk/conversation/CL:次[ci4]
to arrange an interview/an appointment (with the foreign ambassador)
to discuss/to converse/chat/discussion
to meet/meeting/conference
to get along well (with sb)/congenial/to speculate (on financial markets)
to part on bad terms/(of a meeting etc) to break up in discord
to chat
variant of 閒談|闲谈[xian2 tan2]
talks/discussions/CL:次[ci4]
to exchange conventional greetings/to exchange pleasantries
